page.title: 11Salvation Army Corps
page.content: The Salvation Army started in Lavenham on 19th June 1884 with an open-air meeting in Bolton Street,led by a converted hawker named Â£Gypsy' Knights. Since then the Gospel message of Jesus has been proclaimed both in our Hall on the Common and in the streets of Lavenham. The band is heard regularly on the Market Place,also at Christmas and on Easter morning.Our songsters provide vocal music for all meetings. The weekly programme consists of Ladies meetings, Mother and Toddler Club,Sunday School,Public Sunday meetings and distribution of Army papers in the public houses.All this continuously for the last 100 years!
